intro: Hieracium hapalothrix, commonly known as the white hawk's-beard, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically clustered in a single head. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which are often lobed or toothed. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium hapalothrix is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
